titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress with respect to raising awareness and encouraging education about safety on the Internet and supporting the goals and ideals of National Internet Safety Month.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications and the Internet.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 6/12/2003--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) National Internet Safety Month provides an opportunity to educate the public on the dangers of the Internet and the importance of being safe and responsible online; (2) national and community organizations should be recognized and applauded for their work in promoting awareness of such dangers and providing information on developing critical thinking and decision-making skills to be safe online; and (3) Internet safety organizations, law enforcement, educators, and volunteers should continue to increase their efforts to raise awareness of online safety.
